text: Hey <@U6Z3FRJ2D>, seems like you're referring to nested modules- there's an article on that here. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-to-identify-and-upgrade-nested-modules-from-v1-to-v2-in-the-new-design-manager>

yes <@UBFA10FMF>, thats the origin of the problem, but is more than that, there in that article says: “As long as the original nested module remains in the v1 framework and is not upgraded, any content in these modules that has already been published will continue to render as expected.” and thats not true in this case. The other thing is that the “view dependencies” option on the DM isnt working and says “this module have no dependencies” and we know is in more than 300 pages.
<https://cl.ly/fd22704de7a6>

so we dont know in what exact pages the module is and, in the other hand, we dont know (remember) the exact configuration of that 300 forms “have a thank you message with a cta inside o links to a thank you pages?” since we cant “see” the module on the page editor, we cant know all that kind of things
and yesterday “discovered” the same problem with our custom modules with galleries, thats another problem with the same origin and almost the same number or pages
<@U6Z3FRJ2D> is your forms still broken? I have disabled the ‘minimization’ since yesterday.
ok, i will check it right now wait me 3 min :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah, still broken :disappointed:, but like i say in the treath (and thanks to <@UBFA10FMF> to point the origin) the problem is that the v1 of the module is just broken
but if we could check the dependencies to make a list of the pages with the broken module, we could, at least, have the 50% of the solution
looking into this <@U6Z3FRJ2D>

for the `site_settings` dict, how can we access the form styles colors found under *site settings > marketing > forms*? For example `{{ site_settings.color_picker_favorite_1 }}`
For emails is there a way to enable the web version of the email by default for all emails?
do a `{{site_settings|pprint}}` and paste it in and maybe someone can help (obviously obfuscate any client sensitive data  that may be in there if anything)
I did, nothing about form settings in there
ahh
:disappointed: might not be available yet then via hubl
would have to dig through the developer info for your color codes that are set there to find it
dang, it’s not even in there
:disappointed:
looks like the answer is no

Any chance someone from HubSpot can look into an HTTPs issue for me? One of our larger clients website/blog SSL certificate from CloudFare expired somehow and it is prompting users to stay away from their content. Regular support doesn't seem to know what is happening.
:point_up: im thinking this would be a <@U6GNQ7JBU> thing to look at
<@U6MHBFW1K> ^

according to cloudflare, the ssl's are operational:
<https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/>
Just not expired certs lol
taking a look

For all of you who use or are interested in our APIs ... check this out:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1539800497000100>

they have a CAA issue - they need to modify their CAA records to allow <http://digicert.com|digicert.com>: <https://www.digwebinterface.com/?hostnames=dimplex.com&type=CAA&ns=resolver&useresolver=8.8.4.4&nameservers=>
after that, let me know and I’ll retry validation
I'll make sure to pass this along ... I'll have to hunt to find the team who's thinking about this.
Thanks for digging it up. I'll ask around to see if I can find any updates.
If you dont mind commenting on the ideas.HS thread plllllease with those thoughts... that will be good cuz they monitor the responses.
Will do, ill add it in shortly
been wondering that for some time and dont understand why that is the answer :disappointed:
I completely agree - it’s basically the standard setting anyways for all other email service providers.
I would prefer it on by default and if i dont want it, remove the link in the email code
I would agree
Hey AJ, would you want to just take away Source Code? Or would you want to have more ability to configure exactly which rich text controls the marketer sees?
<@U22PKFRU5> added to the thread
def have more ability to configure, similar to the image below this post thread
it would let us see what plugins HS uses on the TinyMCE editor and then give us some additional flexibility to add/subtract things

For example, I for one love the source code button. BUT, i dont want marketers (or some of them) to be able to access that as some know what they are doing, others have messed up pages far beyond what I would imagine they would do
Amazingly, <@U6GNQ7JBU> does not own everything at HubSpot… yet.
lol i know he's helped with cloudflare issues so I assumed. We need to have a list for these things :slightly_smiling_face:

Just a reminder: this Slack is designed for HubSpot designers and developers to help *each other*. HubSpot employees do hang out here and may help, but if there’s an urgent issue, you should contact HubSpot Support.

Hi folks :wave:
This is Katie, the Product Manager of HubSpot's Page Editing team. Over the past couple of months, the team has been working on a new drag and drop page editor, and today, I'm excited to announce that we're moving into a private beta.

We're looking for feedback on the developer experience, so if you're interested in trying it out, fill out this form and I'll ungate your account!

<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfyp9mMckWylCsVv2fpdbB3FTnLDoYBOk-pyXjszoARek-L8w/viewform?usp=sf_link>

We've made it so that you can convert your existing templates into templates that create drag and drop pages. For some extra background, here's a guide to the ways you can convert templates in the design manager.
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1s8HjBJqdeD5MP5JO5FY2nBRXAp1wtxObQkdsAXuWdn4/edit?usp=sharing>

This thing is pretty rad y’all! - Get in there and check it out. Will make your life’s easier as devs... wont have to make tons of tiny updates. Empower your marketers to do it. You can focus on coding more complex things.
